intro: Alangium barbatum subsp. faberi, commonly known as the Chinese alangium, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in horticulture and conservation efforts.
